Getting start with my mac like a Pro

Setting up a new computer takes time since we need to put all great tools and configs into the computer. Having a list is useful and here is my list.

OSX Settings

  • Mouse Setting - Go to System Preference > Trackpad - then enable “Tap to click” and “3 Finger Drag”
  • Show Hidden Files
  • Keyboard Shortcuts–One great thing about mac setting is you
  • alt – alt + - = –, alt + = = ≠, alt + < = ≤, alt + > = ≥

Installing and Setting up Apps

Manually Downloaded

Productivity (Daily Use)

  • Chrome – is my #1 browser (My List of Plugins coming soon!)

  • Firefox – for rendering some web that’s bad in Chrome and, of course, for testing.

  • Dropbox & Google Drive – for syncing files

  • Alfred – help me Launch Apps faster (I replace Quicksilver with Alfred)

  • Growl – for many notification

  • Fluid App - Create Application file for your favorite web apps so that you can easily click them from the dock and have their own windows and tabs. Each “app” created also have their own bookmark, which is very helpful Use http://iconverticons.com to create icons for an app you like! - I use fluid app to create apps for Github and Twitter Bootstrap.

  • SecondBar - Duplicate Menubar to your second screen. (ALERT! Somehow this app interferes with SublimeText2)

Productivity (Good to have)

  • NTFS Write support – very important if you have NTFS hard drives

  • CoBook – better address book, (Killer Feature: able to sync with Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter.)

  • Spectacle – help me snaps windows (like Window’s Aura interface). I suggest changing keys for “Fullscreen” to Ctrl+Shift+F and “center” to Ctrl+Shift+C (to avoid conflicts with “Copy Style” for the key “Cmd+Shift+C”) (ALERT! This app works well with most apps besides OmniGraffle and VLC)

  • Quicklook Plugins – help your mac’s quicklook able to quick look more type of files. See GigaOm

Entertainment

  • Spotify - free music!
  • VLC – for opening various video files
  • Flip4Mac – WMV Encoding for mac.

Design

  • OSX’s System ColorPicker is not bad (much better than windows.)–especially with some addons:

    • First, this color picker is cool except that you cannot access it from anywhere in the OS. This Script for ColorPicker Direct access helps a lot.

    • Other Plugin (should be put in 

      REXML could not parse this XML/HTML: 
<home>/Library/ColorPickers)

      • Developer Color Picker
      • Antetype Color Picker: Photoshop-like picker plugin
      • HexPicker

  • CandyBar

  • Image Optim Optimize Images

http://www.iconboxapp.com/

http://yuji.wordpress.com/2010/08/01/mac-adding-hex-color-picker-to-color-picker/ plugin for Mac’s ColorPicker hexpicker

Development

  • iTerm2 - better terminal replacement. - Tomorrow Night is not a bad theme.

  • Sublime Text – one of the best text editor (I can definitely say it’s the best cross platform one), support TextMate’s script as well! (Killer Feature: List of plugins I use)

  • Cyberduck – Quick FTP

  • CdTo - open the current finder folder in terminal. Don’t forget to setup iterm2 plugin in your finder!

  • Apple Command Line Tools

  • XCode (Optional) Of course, for coding objective C for Mac and iOS apps. However, I don’t always install it until I need to use it.

  • Eclipse/Aptana Studio (Optional)

  • ~~CHMViewer – for Seeing CHM Help files~~ (With Dash, I mostly have forgot about CHM files)

App Store

Free

Productivity

  • Evernote: All kind of notes!
  • Skitch – quick annotate & screen capture (also by Evernote)
  • Unarchiver
  • Sparrow Lite - still the best clean & simple Email client on Mac even though Google has acquired it.
  • Timeout Free - help me break from work and be calm!

Design

  • HexColor

Software Development

  • SourceTree - Great Tool for git (Much better than gitx!)
  • Sequel Pro - for browsing Database instance

Bought

Productivity

  • Fantastical - great calendar on menubar works with either iCal or Outlook
  • DayOne - great for diary
  • 1Password - never need to type long password again + let it generate secure password for you.

Office

  • Apple iWork – Page and Keynote, apart from a good office software, are amazing tools for prototyping!

Design

  • Spectrum – wonderful color picker

Blogging

  • Marked: Markdown renderer–works great with Sublime text 2

Software Development

  • Dash – quick documentation offline, create quick snippet that will incredibly save your time! - I also set the following dockets with keywords

    - It’s text expansion isn’t as good as Text Expander yet. But well, it’s much cheaper.

Already come with Mac.

Productivity

  • Mail - Apple’s Mail app. Some people like it over Sparrow It works much better with gmail if you set easy shortcut key to “archive” and “flag” (eq. to star on Gmail). I use F1 for archive and F2 for Flag.

  • Console – great free & simple tool for looking at Mac

  • sips – great command line tool for batch resizing image

Shortcut Keys for Apps

  • Finder Addons

Create one from image is also pretty useful Other image tools http://www.cssdrive.com/imagepalette/index.php Colorhexa – not an app but useful tool for picking colors

I want to try

  • setting up zsh sheel

  • Pick color theme from color theme gallery.

Please feel free to recommend if you have any cool tool/apps suggestion. I will keep updating this list!
